sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The northern ditty: or, The Scotch-man out-witted by the country damsel. To an excellent new Scotch tune, of Cold and raw the north did blow, &c. A song much in request at Court. This may be printed, R.P. D'Urfey, Thomas, 1653-1723.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for P. Brooksby, J. Deacon, J. Blare, J. Back., [London] : [1692?]
Attributed to Thomas D'Urfey by Wing. Verse: "Cold and raw the north did blow ..." Place and date of publication suggested by Wing. Trimmed. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
The northern ditty: or, The Scotch-man out-witted by the country damsel. To an excellent new Scotch tune, of Cold and raw the north did blow, &c. A song much in request at Court. This may be printed, R.P. D'Urfey, Thomas, 1653-1723.
1 sheet ([1] p.) : ill. (woodcuts).
Printed for P. Brooksby, J. Deacon, J. Blare, J. Back., [London] : [1692?]
Attributed to Thomas D'Urfey by Wing. Verse: "Cold and raw the north did blow ..." Place and date of publication suggested by Wing. Trimmed. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
J. Back.
J. Blare
J. Deacon
P. Brooksby
